level.heading: Reasonable suspicion testing.
level.text: ยง 17-606 Reasonable suspicion testing. Nothing in this chapter shall preclude a motor carrier from administering a drug test when the motor carrier has a reasonable suspicion that a driver is using an illegal drug or when the chancellor of the board of education, or his or her designee, has a reasonable suspicion that a driver is using an illegal drug and requests that a driver take a drug test.
